name: When In London Quiz | England | 10 Questions

questions.correct: Junction of Victoria St and Vauxhall Bridge Rd
questions.explanation:
Junction of Victoria St and Vauxhall Bridge Rd.

	Little Ben stands at the junction of Victoria St and Vauxhall Bridge Rd, across from the Victoria Palace Theatre...

questions.text: Which tube station is closest to Lords Cricket Ground?
questions.explanation:
St Johns Wood.

	Lords Cricket Ground is the premier cricket stadium in England and the headquarters of the sport's governing body, the MCC (Marylebone Cricket Club).

questions.text: Which football (soccer) club used to play home games at White Hart Lane?
questions.explanation:
Tottenham Hotspur.

	White Hart Lane was a first rate stadium that has undergone some terrific renovations and was home to the 'Spurs'.  It was demolished in 2017.

questions.text: In which London Street is Liberty's Department Store ?
questions.explanation:
Regent St.

	Liberty's has a distinctive Tudor style facade...

questions.text: Where is the monument to Oscar Wilde?
questions.explanation:
Adelaide St.

	The Oscar Wilde monument was dedicated in 1998 and is in Adelaide St near Charing Cross Station...

Hyde Park.

	This magnificent gate is in Hyde Park Corner and serves to close the park's ring road to traffic at night...

questions.text: Which London Underground Station is closest to Trafalgar Square?
questions.explanation:
Charing Cross.

	Charing Cross is also a mainline rail station that serves the south east of England...

questions.text: What gift from the Norwegian people is placed in Trafalgar Square every year?
options: A giant bird bath for pigeons
questions.explanation:
A giant Christmas Tree.

	A giant tree is erected every year in the square. It is a gift from Norway, as thanks for Norway's liberation in World War II.

A gigantic ferris wheel.

	The London Eye or Millennium Wheel was constructed for London's Millennium celebrations and stands on the south bank of the river Thames, overlooking the old county hall...

questions.text: What type of stores are typical to Charing Cross Road?
questions.explanation:
Book stores.

	Charing Cross Rd is famed for its book stores which include Foyles, reputed to be the biggest book store in the world.
